Quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: As I would not be a slave, so I would not be a master. This expresses my idea of democracy
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: The difference between what we do and what we are capable of doing would suffice to solve most of the world's problems
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Twenty years from now you will be more dissapointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.
Author: Nora Roberts

Quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It is better to keep your mouth shut and give the impression that you are stupid than to open it and remove all doubt.
Author: Rami Belson

Quote: In any situation, the best thing you can do is the right thing; the next best thing you can do is the wrong thing; the worst thing you can do is nothing
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: It's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety nine percent perspiration
Author: Thomas Alva Edison

Quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: All we are is the result of what we have thought
Author: Buddha

Quote: Let me say, at the risk of seeming ridiculous, that the true revolutionary is guided by great feelings of love
Author: Che Guevara

Quote: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Life is too important to be taken seriously
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: No army can withstand the strength of an idea whose time has come
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, therefore, is not an act but a habit.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Take pride in how far you have come, and have faith in how far you can go
Author: Christian Larson

Quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: If you could say it in words there would be no reason to paint
Author: Edward Hopped

Quote: Only those who risk going to far can possibly find out how far one can go.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day; begin it well and serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Build what can't be bought
Author: Grey Liedtke

Quote: Careers are not had by wishing and hoping. They are bought with work and enthusiasm
Author: Norman Lewis
Source: 30 days to a more powerful vocabulary

Quote: Even the sharpest cactus is filled with water
Author: Grey Liedtke

Quote: A turtle without a shell is better than a man without a dream
Author: Grey Liedtke

Quote: If you save the best slice for last, you better eat it
Author: Grey Liedtke

Quote: Coming back to where you were is not the same as never leaving
Author: Pat Nurse
column4: Put note in her hand and kissed forehead

Quote: Love is initially an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: We are all broken in some way, that's how the light gets in
Author: Ernest Hemmingway

Quote: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Leap and the net will appear.
Author: Zen Proverb

Quote: The two most important days in your life are the day you were born and the day you find out why
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: Get busy living or get busy dying
Author: Stephen Kin

Quote: If you can't do great things, do small things in a great way
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: “The best way to verify that you are alive is by checking if you like variations. Remember that food would not have a taste if it weren’t for hunger; results are meaningless without effort, joy without sadness, convictions without uncertainty, and an ethical life isn’t so when stripped of personal risks.”
Author: Nassim Taleb

Quote: one of the greatest feelings in human experience is to feel so small in a world that is so big
Author: Marc Andre Leblanc

Quote: The proper function of man is to live, not to exist. I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them. I shall use my time.
Author: Jack London

Quote: There is nothing the busied man is less busy with than living: there is nothing that is harder to learn.
Author: Too busy to pay attention

Quote: Evil must constantly respawn, while good, while virtue, is immortal. Vice has always a new fresh young face, while virtue is venerable as nothing else in the world is.
Author: John Steinbeck

Quote: It is one of the triumphs of the human that he can know a thing and still not believe it.
Author: John Steinbeck

Quote: We're here. Might as well enjoy it
Author: Johnathan

Quote: I believe that what self-centered men have torn down, men other centered can build up
Author: MLK

Quote: People are like magnets. You attract what you are
Author: Laura Liedtke

Quote: Winners never quit so quitters never win
Author: Rex

Quote: Be so good they can't ignore you
Author: Steve Martin

Quote: What is a cynic? A man who knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.
Author: Oscar Wilde
